official.headline: Calibration Restores Flow
official.anchor_line: Stenograd Council launches citywide calibration using the Behavioral Compliance Index to restore smooth access for all.
official.contextual_reframing: Every citizen benefits from enhanced efficiency as updated routines ensure trusted services citywide. The BCI, a real-time scoring system for individual alignment, remains pivotal in Stenograd’s progress.

official.headline: Neighborhoods Embrace Change
official.anchor_line: Several neighborhoods report improved access and streamlined services with renewed BCI routines.
official.contextual_reframing: These community successes underscore the value of routine calibration in fostering secure, predictable urban living for all residents.

official.headline: Dialogue Strengthens Unity
official.anchor_line: Public discussions spark across the city as residents engage with new compliance prompts.
official.contextual_reframing: Open dialogue and active engagement highlight Stenograd’s spirit of collective adaptation and resilience under the advanced urban system.

underground.headline: Calibration or Control?
underground.anchor_line: The city's so-called calibration drive just means more eyes on you, more hoops to jump through.
underground.contextual_reframing: Stenograd's 'Behavioral Compliance Index' tracks every move, linking your score to work, home, and health. If your number drops, so do your chances. That's how control works now.

underground.headline: Access Game Rigged
underground.anchor_line: Some districts get smoother services. Others are left waiting, stalled by hidden system prompts with Halden's old codes.
underground.contextual_reframing: People whisper about secret restrictions buried in the tech. If you're not aligned, you're delayed, denied, or locked out. Old pilot zones know this story all too well.

underground.headline: Rumors Echo Loud
underground.anchor_line: Neighbors argue about what the prompts really mean while cracks open in the Council’s narrative.
underground.contextual_reframing: Debate, sabotage, secret meets — that's how people resist. The system calls it 'restored order.' We call it survival. Stay sharp. Stay together.
